content.title: West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme: State Capital Investment Subsidy
content.department: Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Textiles, Government of West Bengal
content.details: The scheme 'State Capital Investment Subsidy' is a sub scheme under 'West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme'. It was launched on 13 December, 2022, and shall remain valid up to five years. The objective is to extend fiscal incentives to the textile sector across the entire value chain starting from fibre to stitched garments for setting up such units in the State.
benefits: 10% subsidy for spinning (short staple) with a maximum admissible amount of ₹2,00,00,00,00/-
20% subsidy for weaving & knitting (warp and flat-bed) and texturing & twisting with a maximum admissible amount of ₹1,00,00,00,00/-
10% subsidy for circular knitting with a maximum admissible amount of ₹50,00,00,00/-
20% subsidy for dyeing and processing of fibers, yarn, fabric and garment with a maximum admissible amount of ₹2,00,00,00,00/-
20% subsidy for technical textile (Agrotech, Buildtech, Indutech, Geotech, and Medi-tech) and non-woven fabric manufacturing with a maximum admissible amount of ₹2,50,00,00,00/-
10% subsidy for technical textile (all categories except Agrotech, Buildtech, Indutech, Geotech, and Medi-tech) with a maximum admissible amount of ₹1,00,00,00,00/-
20% subsidy for polymerization with a maximum admissible amount of ₹5,00,00,00,00/-
10% subsidy for composite type of textile unit with a maximum admissible amount of ₹5,00,00,00,00/-
eligibility: Industries in the manufacturing and processing of textiles, apparel and technical textiles products.
The unit should have started production on or after 1st April 2022.
The units may be in the private sector, co-operative sector, joint sector as also companies/undertakings owned or managed by the State Government.
The project should have been approved and sanctioned by a Central Financial Institution or Commercial Banks or State Financial Institutions.
The unit should hold a Registration Certificate, Date of Commencement Certificate and Eligibility Certificate issued by the Directorate of Textiles.
exclusions: The incentives shall not be applicable to the industrial units/ enterprises that have been registered and for which eligibility certificates have been issued /incentives have been sanctioned and disbursed under the respective Incentive Scheme of the State.
That has been registered and for which eligibility certificates have been issued in terms of the respective Incentive Scheme of the State but no claim and sanction of incentive has been made.
documents_required: Auditor’s/ Chartered Accountant’s Certificate for utilization of funds.
A certificate from a Chartered Accountant as per Annexure - I.
A certificate in respect of fixed assets as per Annexure - II.

faqs.question: What is an 'Approved Project' as defined under the guidelines?
faqs.answer: 'Approved Project' means the industrial project of an industry/an expansion project in the manufacturing of textile sector which should be approved prior to implementation of the project by Directorate of Textiles.

faqs.question: What is an 'Eligible Unit/Enterprise'?
faqs.answer: 'Eligible Unit/Enterprise' means an enterprise in textile sector which has obtained Udyam Registration/Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum (IEM) Part- B or Registration as per notification of Government of India.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for incentives under The West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme?
faqs.answer: The WBTIS shall generally be applicable to industries in the manufacturing and processing of textiles, apparel and technical textiles products which have started production on or after 1st April 2022.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for claiming the Subsidy?
faqs.answer: An eligible textile sector enterprise needs to apply online for the subsidy along with the required documents as per the guidelines provided by the concerned department.

faqs.question: Can an eligible textile sector enterprise avail of incentives under both 'The West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme, 2022' and other state incentive schemes simultaneously?
faqs.answer: No, an eligible textile sector enterprise cannot avail incentives under both schemes simultaneously.
